CalendarEventsProxy * mpCalendarEventsProxy

Detailed Description

Constants and helpers for the Calendar Events, Instances and Attendees table.

The following example demonstrates how to use the CalendarEvents

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {
     // new Context instance
     Context* context = new Context(this);

     // new CalendarEvents
     CalendarEvents events(*context);

     //add value
     ContentValues cv;
     cv.addValue(CalendarEvents::Events::ALL_DAY(), 1);
     events.add(CalendarEvents::CALENDAR_EVENTS_URI(), cv);

     //set value
     ContentValues cv2;
     cv2.addValue(CalendarEvents::Events::TITLE(), "Meeting");
     events.set(CalendarEvents::CALENDAR_EVENTS_URI(), cv2, "_ID=0", NULL);

     //get value
     Cursor* results = events.getN(CalendarEvents::CALENDAR_INSTANCES_URI(),
         NULL,
         CalendarEvents::Instances::_ID() + "=1",
         NULL,
         NULL);

     if (results != NULL && results->moveToFirst()) {
         do {
             // ...do something
         } while (results->moveToNext());
     }

     //remove value
     events.remove(CalendarEvents::CALENDAR_EVENTS_URI(), "_ID=0", NULL);

     delete results;
     delete context;
 }

Definition at line 75 of file CalendarEvents.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::content::CalendarEvents::AccessLevels

Events access levels default value.

Enumerator:
ACCESS_DEFAULT 

Default access is controlled by the server and will be treated as public on the device.

ACCESS_CONFIDENTIAL 

Confidential is not used by the app.

ACCESS_PRIVATE 

Private shares the event as a free/busy slot with no details.

ACCESS_PUBLIC 

Public makes the contents visible to anyone with access to the calendar.

enum gaia::content::CalendarEvents::AttendeeTypes

AttendeeType defaults value.

Enumerator:
TYPE_NONE 

Type none.

TYPE_REQUIRED 

Type required.

TYPE_OPTIONAL 

Type optional.

TYPE_RESOURCE 

This specifies that an attendee is a resource, like a room, a cabbage, or something and not an actual person.

Definition at line 847 of file CalendarEvents.h.

enum gaia::content::CalendarEvents::Availabilities

Events availabilities default value.

Enumerator:
AVAILABILITY_BUSY 

Indicates that this event takes up time and will conflict with other events.

AVAILABILITY_FREE 

Indicates that this event is free time and will not conflict with other events.

AVAILABILITY_TENTATIVE 

Indicates that the owner's availability may change, but should be considered busy time that will conflict.

Member Function Documentation

static const base::String gaia::content::CalendarEvents::ACTION_HANDLE_CUSTOM_EVENT ( ) [static]

Page Action: Display the event to the user in the custom app as specified in CalendarEvents::Events#CUSTOM_APP_PACKAGE.

The custom app will be started via gaia::core::Page#startPageForResult and it should call gaia::core::Page#setResult(int32_t) with gaia::core::Page#RESULT_OK or gaia::core::Page#RESULT_CANCELED to acknowledge whether the action was handled or not.

The custom app should have an demand-filter like the following 

 
 <demand-filter>
    <action gaia:name="android.provider.calendar.action.HANDLE_CUSTOM_EVENT" />
    <category gaia:name="android.intent.category.DEFAULT" />
    <data gaia:mimeType="vnd.android.cursor.item/event" />
 </demand-filter>

Input: gaia::core::Demand#getData has the event URI. The extra EXTRA_EVENT_BEGIN_TIME has the start time of the instance. The extra EXTRA_CUSTOM_APP_URI will have the CalendarEvents::Events#CUSTOM_APP_URI.

Output: gaia::core::Page#RESULT_OK if this was handled; otherwise gaia::core::Page#RESULT_CANCELED

static net::Uri gaia::content::CalendarEvents::CALENDAR_ATTENDEES_URI ( ) [static]

The content:// style URL for accessing Attendees data.

static net::Uri gaia::content::CalendarEvents::CALENDAR_EVENTS_URI ( ) [static]

The content:// style URL for interacting with events.

Appending an specify a single event.

static net::Uri gaia::content::CalendarEvents::CALENDAR_INSTANCES_BY_DAY_URI ( ) [static]

The content:// style URL for querying an instance range by Julian Day.

The start and end day should be added as path segments if this is used directly.

static net::Uri gaia::content::CalendarEvents::CALENDAR_INSTANCES_URI ( ) [static]

The content:// style URL for querying an instance range.

The begin and end of the range to query should be added as path segments if this is used directly.

static net::Uri gaia::content::CalendarEvents::CALENDAR_SEARCH_INSTANCES_BY_DAY_URI ( ) [static]

The content:// style URL for querying an instance range with a search term.

The start day, end day, and search string should be appended as path segments if this is used directly.

static net::Uri gaia::content::CalendarEvents::CALENDAR_SEARCH_INSTANCES_URI ( ) [static]

The content:// style URL for querying an instance range with a search term.

The begin, end, and search string should be appended as path segments if this is used directly.

storage::Cursor* gaia::content::CalendarEvents::getInstancesRangeByDayN ( int64_t  startDay,
int64_t  endDay,
base::StringArray *const  selection,
base::String *const  where,
base::StringArray *const  whereArgs,
base::String *const  sort 
)

Query the instances table in a specific range by Julian Day The start and end day should be added if this is used directly.

Parameters:
startDayThe begin day in Julian format.
endDayThe end day in Julian format.
selectionA list of which columns to return. Passing NULL will return all columns, which is discouraged to prevent reading data from storage that isn't going to be used.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing NULL will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
sortHow to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing NULL will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
Returns:
A Cursor object, which is positioned before the first entry. Note that Cursors are not synchronized, see the documentation for more details.
